example.eg: Ian tore a banana off the bunch and began to peel it.
example.egtrans: 伊恩从一把香蕉里扯下一根，然后开始剥皮。

example.eg: Marcy had toast and a small bunch of grapes for breakfast.
example.egtrans: 玛茜早餐吃了吐司和一小串葡萄。

example.eg: The magician pulled a bunch of flowers from his sleeve.
example.egtrans: 魔术师从袖子中抽出了一束花。

example.eg: The prison guard had a bunch of keys dangling from his belt.
example.egtrans: 狱警的皮带上挂着一串钥匙。

example.eg: The smallest key on the bunch opens my jewelry box.
example.egtrans: 钥匙串上最小的那把是用来开我的首饰盒的。

example.eg: Tell that bunch over there that the store is closing in ten minutes.
example.egtrans: 去告诉那群人，商店还有10分钟就关门了。

example.eg: The leaves in the pond are bunching together.
example.egtrans: 池塘里的落叶聚在了一起。

example.eg: Your dress is bunching at the back.
I've got a bunch of work to do today.
I learned a bunch from that painting demonstration.
example.egtrans: 我从那次书画观摩中学到了许多。

example.eg: Take as many beers as you like; I've got a bunch of them.
example.egtrans: 你想拿多少啤酒就拿多少，我有一堆呢。

example.eg: The little girl wore her blonde hair in bunches.
The frightened goats bunched together in the pasture.
The cyclists had bunched up as they approached a sharp bend in the road.
The dress didn't fit Sophie because it bunched up at the back.
He brought her a bunch of flowers on their first date.

dsense.name: get your panties in a bunch (US), get your knickers in a twist (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对...过分沮丧, 因...而过分紧张

dsense.name: Thanks a bunch
dsense.guideword: mainly US, ironic, slang (thank you very much)

example.eg: Thanks a bunch for driving off and leaving me to stand in the rain.
